subject: Career
title: The Right to Disconnect in Remote Work
description: A quick win: understand The Right to Disconnect in Remote Work.

hook.text: Remote workers log 2.5 more hours daily than office workers. Freedom became a longer workday.

buildup.text: Without physical separation, work bleeds into every corner of life. The office never closes.

discovery.text: Multiple countries now legislate the 'right to disconnect' â€” banning after-hours work communication.

twist.text: Even without legislation, teams can self-impose disconnect norms. It just takes one leader to start.

climax.text: Set team norms: no messages after 6 PM, use scheduled send, and respect time zones religiously.

punchline.text: Remote freedom without boundaries isn't freedom. It's a 24-hour office.

quiz.question: How many more hours do remote workers log daily compared to office workers?
